page.title: 11The Fox public house, Ousden
page.content: The village pub is always a popular meeting place and the Fox is no exception, not only with local people but with some customers coming some miles to enjoy a drink. It has two bars, public and saloon, and a very nice garden where one can sit in the summer months. Many of the regular customers enjoy various games such as cards, dominoes or darts and there is a pool table. In the saloon bar there is a piano, and now and again they have a sing song. During the week, various foods are served from a packet of crisps or peanuts to a full meal. The landlady holds the pub licence in her own right; but the Fox is actually owned by Greene King Brewery, as are most of the pubs in this area. YLLAER05760216
